m4/interrupt.h File Reference
CSL ARCH Module » M4 » Interrupt

This file contains the API prototypes for configuring INTC for ARM Cortex-M4. More...

#include <stdint.h>
#include <ti/csl/hw_types.h>

Macros

#define EXCEPTION_M4_RESET_NUM_1   (1U)
 List of Exceptions in M4. These exceptions are interrupts from 1 to 15 in Vector table. More...
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_NMI_NUM_2   (2U)
 Exception for External NMI inputs.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_HARD_FAULT_NUM_3   (3U)
 Exception for All fault conditions, if the fault handle is not enabled.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_MEM_MANAGE_NUM_4   (4U)
 Exception for Memory management fault; access to illegal locations.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_BUS_FAULT_NUM_5   (5U)
 Exception for Bus error.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_USUAGE_FAULT_NUM_6   (6U)
 Exception for Program error.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_RESERVED_NUM_7   (7U)
 Reserved.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_RESERVED_NUM_8   (8U)
 Reserved.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_RESERVED_NUM_9   (9U)
 Reserved.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_RESERVED_NUM_10   (10U)
 Reserved.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_SVCALL_NUM_11   (11U)
 Exception for Service system Call.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_DEBUG_MONITOR_NUM_12   (12U)
 Exception for BP,WP or external debug req.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_RESERVED_NUM_13   (13U)
 Reserved.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_PENDSV_NUM_14   (14U)
 Exception for Pendable request for system device.
 
#define EXCEPTION_M4_SYSTICK_NUM_15   (15U)
 Exception for System Tick Timer.
 

Functions

void Intc_Init (void)
 This API is used to initialize the interrupt controller. This API shall be called before using the interrupt controller. This API will reset the Vector table to defualt value and unregister all registered interrupt. More...
 
void Intc_IntRegister (uint16_t intrNum, IntrFuncPtr fptr, void *fun_arg)
 Registers an interrupt Handler in the interrupt vector table for system interrupts. More...
 
void Intc_IntUnregister (uint16_t intrNum)
 Unregisters an interrupt. More...
 
void Intc_IntPrioritySet (uint16_t intrNum, uint16_t priority, uint8_t hostIntRoute)
 This API assigns a priority to an interrupt and routes it to either IRQ or to FIQ. Priority 0 is the highest priority level Among the host interrupts, FIQ has more priority than IRQ. More...
 
void Intc_SystemEnable (uint16_t intrNum)
 This API enables the system interrupt in INTC. However, for the interrupt generation, make sure that the interrupt is enabled at the peripheral level also. More...
 
void Intc_SystemDisable (uint16_t intrNum)
 This API disables the system interrupt in INTC. More...
 
uint8_t Intc_IntDisable (void)
 Read and save the stasus and Disables the processor IRQ . Prevents the processor to respond to IRQs. More...
 
void Intc_IntEnable (uint32_t status)
 Restore the processor IRQ only status. This does not affect the set of interrupts enabled/disabled in the AINTC. More...
 
void Intc_IntClrPend (uint16_t intrNum)
 This API clears the pending system interrupt in INTC.
 

Detailed Description

This file contains the API prototypes for configuring INTC for ARM Cortex-M4.
